fields.Title: PAWNSHOP / RACK OF SECOND-HAND UNIFORMS

Bird's Nest Roy: ""Besides, I've been to Katla, thoug..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Besides, I've been to Katla, though not quite as far north as the Hjelmdall, and watched the northern lights travel across the sky. Very unique energetic tides there."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He smirks. "It's a simple matter of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He smirks. "It's a simple matter of cause and effect, and recognizing that they work in both directions."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You'll just have to buy it, then,"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You'll just have to buy it, then," he replies with a dry smile. "But it's not like it's *expensive*."

fields.Dialogue Text: "In fact..." He leans in. "Most people don't think that the Man from Hjelmdall ever really existed, but they are *wrong*."

fields.Dialogue Text: "Two reál."

fields.Dialogue Text: "It should belong to anyone who is ready to wear it."

fields.Title: You: ""The Man from Hjelmdall is a supers..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Man from Hjelmdall is a superstar, I'm a superstar -- it would be perfect!"

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: "He drums his fingers on the counter..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He drums his fingers on the counter. "I doubt the real Man from Hjelmdall was as poor a role model as the one in the popular literature."

Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hmm, I think you might be thinking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hmm, I think you might be thinking about someone else I... dislike music," he frowns. "So I couldn't tell you who."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh... I see. That's tough, man, I..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh... I see. That's tough, man, I feel the same way sometimes. The Man from Hjelmdall is the hero of a series of popular books based on a fictional version of Katla."

fields.Title: You: ""You said everything's going to be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You said everything's going to be over soon anyway, man. I just want to walk into the end times wearing this t-shirt."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Interesting choice. But sure, why..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Interesting choice. But sure, why not -- take it. Welcome to Hjelmdall."

fields.Title: You: ""Cool, I'll think about it.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Cool, I'll think about it."

fields.Title: You: "(Lie) "I was a very sheltered child..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Lie) "I was a very sheltered child -- my parents only let me read boring books about ordinary people, and the Man from Hjelmdall looks *extraordinary*."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The Man from Hjelmdall is the hero..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Man from Hjelmdall is the hero of a series of popular books based on a fictional version of Katla, mostly what is nowadays Arda NFD."

fields.Title: Jump to: [mainhub]
Bird's Nest Roy: ""He left his native village of Hjel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "He left his native village of Hjelmdall after his son was kidnapped, having many exciting adventures and killing many enemies with his swords, but he lost his family in the process. Tragic stuff, really."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""It's not that complicated. All tha..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's not that complicated. All that's required is a more robust understanding of cause and effect."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm going to call bullshit right n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm going to call bullshit right now."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Neither is the Man a real man, of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Neither is the Man a real man, of course, but both the Man and Hjelmdall are an ontological necessity..." He stops abruptly. "But, hey, it's not worth getting into an argument about."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "Stop talking about this nerd stuff...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Stop talking about this nerd stuff. It will make you *weedy*.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Hell yeah, man." The shopkeep soun..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hell yeah, man." The shopkeep sounds enthusiastic. "I don't usually carry printed tees, but this one was just such a pure exemplar."

Rack of Second-Hand Uniforms: "*Oh* yeah. The print depicts a musc..."

fields.Title: Drama: "Lie, sire. For no reason."
